description: Golden example for rejecting inappropriate automation due to high-stakes, legal liability, and ethical concerns

inputs.problem_statement: Automate resume screening for 200 resumes/week to reduce HR workload from 10 hours to 2 hours
inputs.current_state: Manual review by HR team, 3 minutes per resume average
inputs.proposed_automation: AI resume screening with automatic rejection and interview scheduling

constraints.legal: EEOC regulations require explainable hiring decisions
constraints.bias_risk: AI resume screening has documented bias problems (Amazon, HireVue precedent)
constraints.training_data: Only 500 historical hires across 20 different roles

context.problem_statement: Automate resume screening for 200 resumes/week to reduce HR workload from 10 hours to 2 hours
context.current_state: Manual review by HR team, 3 minutes per resume average
context.proposed_automation: AI resume screening with automatic rejection and interview scheduling

poor_fit_indicators.evidence: Bad hire costs 2-3x salary + team disruption. Wrong rejection loses great candidates.
EEOC regulations require explainable hiring decisions. AI bias lawsuits precedent exists (Amazon, HireVue).
Resume screening AI has documented bias problems (race, gender, age from proxies like names, schools, employment gaps).

suitability_analysis.net_assessment: POOR FIT for automation. 3 critical poor-fit indicators vs 1 good-fit indicator. Risk-to-benefit ratio is unacceptable.

alternatives_explored.description: Standardize job descriptions, create screening rubrics, improve application forms
AI screens resumes, auto-rejects unqualified, auto-schedules interviews

recommendation.rationale: High-stakes + legal liability + ethical concerns + poor ROI = do not proceed. Process improvement delivers better ROI (1.5x) with zero legal risk.
conditions: This verdict holds while hiring remains high-stakes with legal liability
invalidation_triggers: Regulations change to explicitly allow and regulate AI hiring (not current reality)

red_flags: CRITICAL: AI resume screening has documented bias problems. Legal liability is severe.
CRITICAL: EEOC requires explainable hiring decisions. Black-box AI cannot comply.
HIGH: ROI is negative (0.4x) even ignoring legal risk.
honest_truths: Your problem isn't resume volume, it's unclear job requirements leading to unqualified applicants.
If you automate hiring and get sued for bias, the cost will be 10-50x the time savings.
